derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English: from late Latin defloratio(n-), from the verb deflorare (see deflower)

means.word_mean: 1. an act that despoils the innocence or beauty of something
2. the act of depriving a woman of her virginity (especially by rupturing the hymen through sexual intercourse)
